ngoList.title: RAAG TARANG MANDAL
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Raag Tarang Mandal produce more than 20 dance dramas and solo Manipuri classical dances. After demise of founding Guru, Smt. H. Aruna Devi renown Manipuri Folk and Classical Dancer, young artistes have been guiding by Hanjabam Shatananda Sharma who has been actively involved in various theatre groups and trained under eminent theatre personalities. Under the leadership of Hanjabam Shatananda Sharma a group of young telented artistes who are heavily trained in various performing art forms are producing stage plays for the last five years. In the year 2013: 1. Workshop cum dance drama "Chingthangkhomba" under the financial assistance of Art & Culture dept., Govt. of Manipur. In the year 2014: 1.RTM paricipated in All Manipur Short Play Compt. played "Tarang Lalumba" and awarded Best Exprimental Play orgd. by TCM. 2. Gostha Lila(dance) at Manipuri Sangai Festival. In the year 2015: 1. RTMs play "Turel Wangmada" bagged more than seven awards in different categories in 46th All Manipur Short Play Competition for Creative Directors 2015 2. Pung Cholom(Nat Sankritan) at Sangai Festival. In the year 2016: 1.The play "Turel Wangmada" was invited to participate at ABHINAYA National Theatre Festival 2. Our latest play "Samarak ngamarak" bagged more than Five award in different categories in 47th Short play compitetion 2016.

ngoList.title: Rhythms of Manipur
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Rhythms of Manipur occupies a unique position in the world of instrumental music in the region specilising in traditional orchestral music, the company lends itself to composing orchestral pieces from the folklore of Manipur. The company created history in the state by introducing half a dozen of ladies Pena players in 1994.The company which started in 1985 as a little group of music players emerged as one of the largest and active music company in the region in 1995 after the successful presentation of Heirangkhoinida traditional orchestral ensemble based on Pena music with the support of Department of Culture,Government of India.Since then the company has not looking back and succesfully performed over hundreds of performances before highly appreciated audience in various parts of the country.Some of the leading musicians of the company also visited various countries as member of the Indian cultural delegations. A good numbers of dedicated young and talented musicians and researchers comprise the compnay.It also has a long standing association with eminent film, music and theatre directors like A.Syam Sharma,N.Tiken Singh,Dr.Lokendra Arambam. Registered in 1987 as non-profit, non political organisation, the company is supported by the Ministry of Culture,New Delhi since 1994-95 in various art projects and programmes and has a predominantly cultural profile. The Rhythms of Manipur also scored the music of various ballets, dance dramas and films in the state including the children film PAARI made by celebrated film maker Aribam Syam Sharma for the Children Film Society of India which was featured in various international film festivals.The ballet of Maniuri Jagoi Marup â€œEngalleiâ€ which was awarded as the Best Ballet at the 3rd National Ballet Festival organised by the Sahitya Kala Parishad, New Delhi in 1991 also scored by Rhythms of Manipurâ€™s orchestra. Actively involved in the National Theatre Festivals at Bangalore,New Delhi,Kolkota,Kochi in 1999 and 2000 alongwith the Forum For Laboratory Theatres of Manipurâ€™s play â€œChild of the North Eastâ€ directed by Dr.Lokendra Arambam. In 2002 March performed Moirang Sai Opera at the Bharmaputra river in connection of the 50 years of Ford Foundation in India.Sucessfuly organised four days Exhibition cum Festival of Indigenous Musicial Instruments of Manipur with the support of Department of Culture.Government of India in 2002. The year 2007 is one of the memorable year for Rhythms of Manipur, the fast learners and improviserâ€™s musicians of the Rhythms with an attempt to take Manipuri music to a globally acceptable position introduced a modified Pena named as Pennao three string musicial instrument in the presence of a host of cultural luminaries and royal court authorities of the State. Among many concert tours made by the Rhythms of Manipur during the last twentyfour years of its existance mentioned may be made of its participatation in the Best of Music from North East held at Kohima,Nagaland in connection with 50 years of Indian Independence organised by the North East Zone Cultural Centre(NEZCC)Dimapur in 1998,Festival of Manipur,Kolkota organised by the Eastern Zonal Cultural Centre(EZCC)Kolkota in 2003,Two day Choral Singing and Music Festival held at Guwahati organised by the North East Zone Cultural Centre(NEZCC) in 2009,Fusion 1 held at Veethi Sankul auditorium,Bhopal organised by the Indira Gandhi Rastriya Manav Sangrahalaya in 2009. Rhythms of Manipur also actively involved in the annual Manipur Tourism Festival organised by the State Tourism Department with the support of Ministry of Tourism since 2008.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: RNBA has been working tribal community in the northeast region of India for the last 25 years. We have presence with more than 100 villages with 20,000 families. Working 15 NGO partners. RNBA is supporting grassroots NGOs in capacity building and accessing fund and support from well wishers and donors with Govt. line department. We have three major donors; they are Bread for the World/EED Germany, Tata Trusts Mumbai and NABARD. With the support of Bread for the World/EED RNBA has supported 6 NGO partners in 33 villages with around 500 families. Community mobilization, Improved eco-system, market based livelihood and NRM are the major activities. On an average, 3000 rupees incremental income have been ensured by the partners across the target areas. Under Tata Trusts support program, We have Tribal Livleihood program, System of Rice Intensification and Diversion Based Irrigation which covers 13 NGO partners covering more than 15000 farmers. In SRI 10 quintals peracre has been ensured, in DBI 2000 rupees incremental income has been ensured. 115 SHG have been under NABARD support with bank linkage to several SHG. Financial literacy campaign and MEDP programs have been carried out under NABARD.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: RUPEDO, Rural Peopleâ€™s Educational and Development organization is a secular , non- political, non-governmental, non profitable registered society, formed by a group of educated rural locals, having real interest and the commitment to serve the people who are in need . The Vision is the good of all mankind irrespective of caste, creed or religion for a just human society. The Mission of the society is literacy, social awareness, self realization and self support, Rehabilitation, empowerment and encouragement. It has a Plan to work for the community health, development of marginalized groups of society for the neglected citizens and the victims of natural and manmade calamities. Its activities are at present focused on students welfare and encouragement, awareness campaign on health and environmental issues, annual cultural festivals and voluntary participation in social awareness programmes.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Livelihood issue : - 13 Farmers Club in 16 villages have been formed; now they are producing safety food crops in the community - 8 Food banks in 8 villages have been developed and make available in the community at least 10 months in a year - 1 (one) artisansâ€™ club has been formed and taking active participation in the state level Exhibitions - 450 BPL families obtained their BPL, AAY ration cards; they are strongly involve in Advocacy for proper implementation of Public distribution system (PDS). Now they are regularly entitled 35 Kgs of rice and SK oil, LPG in subsidised rate - 400 farmers and women were trained in soap making, detergent powder making, blanket making, organic fertilizer making. Pest management which enhance their daily income Documentation : - Documented bio diversity resources from Five villages for protection - Translated UNSCR 1325 in local dialect Awareness : - 1500 villagers have aware about the issue of food crises at the district for seeking support from concern departments Capacity Building : - 120 women Leaders were given series of trainings on human rights, UNSCR 1325 gender, non- Violent conflict transformation, local capacity for peace - Supported small travel grand to 12 women leaders enable their effective engagement in the women related issue at local, national and international - 4 (Four) women accessed leadership training in Asian Rural Institute, Japan enable to transfer their learning to the rural women Advocacy : - Food distribution system reformed in the state after state level public hearing conducted with our state level partners of sustainable livelihood forum which was convened by WSDC - Initiated in the formation of state level livelihood forum for policy advocacy on food security in Manipur - 237 women victims of HIV-AIDS, armed conflict and widows of Chandel District, Manipur have filed their different petitions before the Harsh Mandal Commission for Public Hearing on Right to Food which was held on 11-12 July, 2012 at Palace Compound Imphal. This Commission recommended valuable directives to the State Chief Secretary relating to PDS benefits to HIV infected persons, armed conflict victims, covering young Widowsâ€™ in pension scheme, priority to widows in rural self employment programs, easy access to PDS items in the remote/hill villages of Manipur. Accordingly these recommendations are materialised w.e.f. April, 2013 Details are enclosed as Annexure. Gender : - 50 Women in Governance (WING) Promoter in 5 villages have been developed; they are actively involving in gender in development and gender violence prevention activities. - Women include in the Village Authority - Women Secular Body in 5 (five) villages have been developed. Now the Body is independently dealing women related schemes, Violence against Women (VAW)

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: During the past three years the organization has provided after care facilities to juveniles who were not having community support and in need of shelter food and economic support. The organisation also setup a model Treatment and rehabilitation Center for drug addicted juvenile boys

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Under the Ministry of Women and Child Government of India, through state Social Welfare Department Government. The project is a part of Integrated Child Protection Scheme, specially designed for the helpless juveniles who are in the age group of 18-21 years, who do not have community ties, immediate relatives to provide shelter and economic support.
Juveniles were given job placement facilities in different work places on leather bag making units carpentry street side hawker service and construction works.
The Juveniles got good support to get self employment and sustainable foundation during the three years of project.
First rehabilitation center for substance and drug abused children in the state with fifteen bedded facilities. It provides treatment detox counseling and follow up services to the young drug users.
